org.apache.sis.util

Interface Deprecable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ImmutableIdentifier

    public interface Deprecable
    Interface of classes for which deprecated instances may exist. Despite the name, the entities deprecated by this interface are unrelated to the entities deprecated by the Java Deprecated annotation. This interface is for identifying deprecated data rather than language constructs.
    Example: When an error is discovered in the definition of a Coordinate Reference System (CRS) in the EPSG database, the EPSG maintainers do not change the data. Instead, they deprecate the erroneous definition and create a new one with a new EPSG code. The isDeprecated() method in this interface allows users to identify CRS instances created from such deprecated database records, for example in order to log a warning when data are projected to a deprecated CRS.
    Some examples of deprecated instances are:
    • An org.apache.sis.referencing.AbstractIdentifiedObject (typically a CRS) which has been built from a deprecated EPSG code.
    • A org.apache.sis.referencing.NamedIdentifier containing the legacy name of an object which has been renamed.
    Since:
    0.3 (derived from geotk-3.20)

    Defined in the sis-utility module (download)
    View source code for this class

      InternationalString getRemarks()
      If this instance is deprecated, the reason or the alternative to use.

    • Method Detail

      • isDeprecated

        boolean isDeprecated()
        Returns true if this instance is deprecated.
        Returns:
        true if this instance is deprecated.

      • getRemarks

        InternationalString getRemarks()
        If this instance is deprecated, the reason or the alternative to use. Otherwise, an optional free text.
        Returns:
        Comments about this instance, or null if none. Shall be the reason for deprecation or the alternative to use if this instance is deprecated.
